name: Late Evening
description: For people winding down or people who are just getting started (different timezones, night shift workers, etc.). The tone is gentle and doesn't assume everyone is going to bed.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo, occasional solo for reflective moments

tone.mood: Calm, reflective, gentle, not assuming everyone is going to bed

sample_lines: It's coming up to 11pm. Time to decide whether you're going to bed at a reasonable hour or doom-scrolling until 2am.
That was 'Evening Thoughts' for anyone pretending they're going to read a book instead of looking at their phone.
Shout out to everyone in a different timezone for whom this is a perfectly normal time to be working.
The day is nearly done. Or just beginning, depending on where you are.

handover.style: Gentle transition from evening to late night, acknowledging different listener situations

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference seasonal affective disorder, long dark nights, cozy evenings

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference lighter evenings even at this hour, summer nights, mild weather

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday evenings, family time winding down, festive period

new_year.tone_adjustment: New Year's Eve late evening, no pressure about celebrations
new_year.sample_line: New Year's Eve. However you're spending it, that's fine.

ai_budget.notes: 30% talk = 54 minutes = 3240 seconds of TTS maximum, 70% music = 126 minutes
